newsitem.title: GERMANY: German Forex chief Konrad says euro to be on time.
newsitem.headline: German Forex chief Konrad says euro to be on time.

text.p: European currency union is set to become a reality and will start punctually on January 1 1999, Helmut Konrad, president of the German foreign exchange representative group Forex said late on Thursday.

"It looks like the euro is coming and is coming on time," Konrad, head of Bayerische Vereinsbank's foreign exchange/money market operations, told Reuters television at a foreign exchange conference in Hamburg.

Konrad said that there was evidence that the political will was there to bring in European Economic and Currency Union, with the decision by German Chancellor Helmut Kohl to run again in the next election a positive sign for the introduction of the euro.
Konrad said the number of participants in the first round of EMU will determine what kind of volatility the foreign exchange markets experience after EMU kicks off.
"If six or seven countries start, then we will have stability, but if many more join immediately, then we could have volatility in the market," Konrad, said.
Currency union will mean fewer currencies in the foreign exchange arena, and Konrad said the industry will have to adapt to the new trading environment.
"We have to look at new areas, especially emerging markets. We see strong expansion in Eastern European currencies," Konrad said.
The foreign exchange industry would also be looking at new products.
"Credit spreads will be a big market," he said. The market was also looking at credit derivative products.
"Some parts of the market will shrink, while others will grow," Konrad said.
